headline: Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
description: These cute peanut butter cup cookies are easy to make in mini muffin pans for the most peanut buttery of treats.

video.name: How to Make Peanut Butter Cup Cookies

name: Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
recipeIngredient: 40 miniature chocolate covered peanut butter cups, unwrapped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Sift together the flour, salt and baking soda; set aside.
Cream together the butter, sugar, peanut butter and brown sugar until fluffy. Beat in the egg, vanilla and milk.
Add the flour mixture; mix well.
Shape into 40 balls and place each into an ungreased mini muffin pan.
Bake at 375 degrees for about 8 minutes.
Remove from oven and immediately press a mini peanut butter cup into each ball. Cool and carefully remove from pan.

review.reviewBody: I think this recipe is worth trying because when you first take out the cookies from the oven and put the peanut butter cups on them it looks so good. One thing is making sure you add everything because it does taste a little dry for me but that may be because I forgot to add the brown sugar or something like that. Overall this is one of the best cookies for a beginner cook to try. I love these cookies almost as much as my Grandma's cookies.
Loved these cookies! Made exactly as directed. They pop out of the pan if you refrigerate for 15-20 minutes after putting pb cups in them. These will not last till the end of the day in my house!
I used a whole cup of extra crunchy peanut butter. Very delicious.

I just made my fourth batch of these cookies. They are a huge hit in our household. I made 2 revisions: First, I used Extra Crunchy peanut butter. Second, I used a one full cup of peanut butter rather than the 1/2 cup in the recipe. The two changes gave us a cookie that has a great texture and a true peanut butter flavor. Delicious cookies!!!

These were sensational. They disappeared quickly. My only problem was that to make as many cookies as recommended, they were smaller and peanut butter cup stuck up a bit. So great tasting, if you are worried about appearance, make them bigger.
I loved it, im sure my relatives will think the same way, however i cooked it for ten minutes the second time and i think it was even better.

This is a fantastic recipe. I don't know the ladies name but I watch all her food videos she is great .I've tried a lot of her recipes they always turn off good every time I looking for a recipe I go to all recipes and find her ü§óüëçüèª

This recipe creates the perfect cookie. I used 1/2 the dough for peanutbutter cups in a mini muffin pan and 1/2 for peanutbutter blossoms using a cooie sheet to bake.Same amount of time. This is a keeper!

Perfect as is. I stuck the cookies in the freezer for about 5 minutes when done and they popped out, no problem. DO NOT overfill the cups (make the alls too big) as it'll give you a 'cookie top' and while this still tastes great they break and are no longer pretty.
this recipe turned out very well, thank you.
I just made these yesterday with my mom& sister! They turned out Great!! Defiantly going in "my recipe box"

This recipe is a family favorite .I have been baking these for my family since 2016.Everyone devours them. I have made them with chocolate mint cups, salted caramel chips, white chocolate chips and they are delicious every time. Thanks for the great recipe. Every oven is different and my oven needs 9 1/2 minutes to make them perfect.
I too used a mix because I was pressed for time. I also did half peanut butter cups and half kisses upside down! disappeared very fast!
Very easy and very good!
Just came out of the oven, can't wait to try them!
Thanks for this recipe it turned out great
The recipe was terrible MX the cookie was undercooked at 8 minutes.
I loved it
I use peanut butter cookie mix from a pouch. Saves alot of time and they taste just as good!
Easy recipe and they are delicious. They were a big hit. Definitely making them again.

After mixing, the dough was slightly too sticky, so I mixed in another 2 Tbsp flour and it was perfect cookie dough consistency. I lined the mini cupcake pan with mini cupcake paper liners, which made for super easy removal from pan and cleanup. Also folded in 1/2 C. mini M7M's to dough, rolling the balls in turbinado sugar before baking. My oven temperature is quite accurate, and I baked for 9 minutes for complete bake. Used the Mini Reese cups, turning them bottom side up, which looked prettier.
Addictive!!!
Delicious, I make them every Christmas. Today I made them with peanut butter pumpkins for fall, rich but soo good!!
I used 3/4 cup peanut butter and 2 tablespoons applesauce and they were moist for a week,love them
Excellent recipe! Didn‚Äôt change a thing!

I've made these a few times and this last time I wasn't paying attention and put the peanut butter cups on before baking. They turned out just as good as putting them on afterwards. These are delicious and I have had many compliments on them.

We loved these cookies, my husband wouldn't stop raving about them! I followed the recipe as written. I don't have a mini muffin pan, but after reading some reviews that said they turn out just fine, I gave it a go. Turns out, the dough is stiff enough that the cookies come out tall enough to push the peanut butter cups into them. I baked them for 8 minutes, but thought maybe I should have baked them an extra minute because the interior on some looked a little undercooked (I wonder if this is because I wasn't using the mini muffin tin?). However, I was worried about not being able to fit the cups into the cookies if I did that, so I didn't try it.
this is the best, i love them so much! great job!
We make these at least once a year and have been doing so for about 10 years. Same recipe. Followed exactly. Love them!

I made this once to make them marijuana edibles by warming up a RSO or high potency syringe full of concentrate and putting it in the butter. The hardest part is making 2 even sized balls.

I tried it a second time without the thc concentrate, and I followed the recipe perfect like the firs time, but the batter was far to liquidy and I kept having to add more and more tablespoons of flour. Not sure what happened. They were still edible and good though
Always amazing! Make them for my husband on his birthday every year.
Delicious! I tried them first at Christmas and everyone loved them! Just made for my second time! This is definitely a recipe that will be used often!

These cookies are awesome. It is an even bet whether or not they are all gone before the are completely cooled. One helpful tip - I made the recipe as specified and they came out great. The next time, however, I will refrigerate the dough and put in just under a measured tablespoon of dough per cup. (Not heaping)
I make these every Christmas with M&M's

My favorite peanut butter cookie! I love this recipe bc it uses butter instead of shortening. We love the richness the butter lends to the cookie. I used this recipe as my base for a blossom cookie. A hit!!!
The only tip I would add other than freezing the peanut butter cups first is to put the tray of cookies in the freezer for a few minutes before taking them out of the pan.
These are delicious I make then every year! Always a hit.

Absolutely awesome and super easy. I would like a little more pb in the cookie so may adjust for that next time, but for my first run this was amazing. Cooking time was exactly 8 minutes. Keep the pb cups in the fridge until you're ready to push them in. After a test batch i rolled the balls in red and green sugar for Christmas and they look great. Keeping this for the annual holiday cookie list!
I love, love, LOVE this cookie!!!!
Certainly holiday favorites! I used non-dairy choc. Pieces bottom right to meet dietary restriction.

Cookies are delicious. I found the cookie and the peanut butter cup maintain shape much better if you use paper liners and you can remove from the pan sooner and more easily. It was a great tip to freeze the peanut butter cups. And FYI Trader Joe's 1 lb container of peanut butter cups contains exactly 40.
have made this for years. easy and delicious, wouldn't change a thing

Made these by the recipe, no modifications. EXCEPT I didn't have the muffln pan or cups so I just put the balls (.6 oz each, yes I'm crazy and I weighed each one) on a cookie sheet. Since there was nothing to keep the dough contained during baking, the cookies were a little wider than in the picture for the recipe. Didn't matter. WOW are these delicious!

Like a lot of people, I unwrapped the pb cups and put them in the freezer. I baked them for 8 minutes, I pulled them out of the oven, put the pb cups in the center and stuck the whole pan in the refrigerator. Made exactly 40! .... because I weighed them....
Not a good recipe. No flavor. Dough too soft. Made according to instructions. Just not a good peanut butter cookie recipe. It said to make 40 balls but no size given
So easy to make and delicious to eat. Our daughter found this recipe and uses it for all her college friends. And now we‚Äôve added it to our Christmas cookie list

Super easy and really delicious! I followed some of the tips here and froze the peanut butter cups first (for about an hour) and a good thing I did! They definitely would have become a gooey mess otherwise.I don‚Äôt have a mini-muffin pan (I should rectify that!) and used parchment lined baking sheets. Worked out well. Might crack/split less with the mini-muffin pan though. Otherwise be very gentle when pressing the peanut butter cups into the centre.
For Christmas, I pipes a red flower and green leaves on top after they cooled.
we use rolos instead of peanut butter cups

I try to avoid dairy, so I swapped out milk for almond milk, and butter for earth balance vegan butter. I also added chocolate chips to half the batch. 

My boyfriend was amazed! He's a tough critic of my cooking, and he doesn't sugar coat anything. He raved about these cookies, enough that it prompted me to make an account here just so I could save the recipe!!
love them
These are the best and always a hit! Thank you for sharing.
I made these for my crew at work, now I am the favorite I have to admit they where SO GOOD! The didn't last long at home or at work

These were delicious and very easy to make. I used gluten free flour and smart balance for the butter due to allergies and turned out awesome. I would highly recommend placing the unwrapped PB cups in the freezer as you make the dough and bake cookies as that made it so much easier to insert after taking out of oven (i was one frozen cup off in counting and placing the non-frozen cup was not as successful-it didn‚Äôt want to push in and melted very quickly. Used Trader Joe dark choc cups...SOOOOOO GOOD!! This recipe is a keeper!!

I would‚Äôve posted a picture after I‚Äôd let them cool, but by the time that happened I walked out to my kitchen.... they were gone! So I assume that means they were delicious!!!!! This works extremely well and isn‚Äôt hard to make at all
I made it exactly as the recipe recipe showed, however I would strongly suggest that you refrigerate the batter for at least an hour so they can solidify to make the balls easier. Otherwise
These cookies were loved by my family and they turned out beautiful as well. the most tedious thing is unwrapping the peanut butter cups. I will make these often!

Super easy to make! I followed the recipe and it came out perfectly. I listened to another review and let them cook for about 5 minutes before I pushed the frozen peanut butter cups into them so the cookie doesn‚Äôt crack. Huge hit with the family! Will definitely make again.

This is my go-to recipe for peanut butter cookies. The family loves them and they are so easy to throw together. I don't always put the candy but when I do I change it up each time by using Rolo's or Dark Chocolate chips or even miniature mixed candies. My daughter loves to use this recipe to make Secret Center Cookies for the holidays too. Just hide the miniatures in the center, bake, and drizzle with melted chocolate. Perfect for parties or gifts! Thanks for this recipe!
Delicious and the recipe is perfect as is!
Easy recipe with great results!
I get asked to make these all the time! Everyone loves them!
Excellent! A new family favorite!

I've made these several times.. They were always a hit at any event I brought them to. I add a little more peanut butter to the recipe and a tiny bit more brown sugar. Because Im bad, ja mon, you know it, ah! These are pro status flavor you could put them in a bakery. Ill add a photo next time I made them.

Very yummy! It was fun to put the pb cup into the warm cookie. I only had one small (12) cupcake pan so I ended up having to put the tray in the fridge to cool faster. It worked well but took a little longer. Really enjoyed making these.

I used Reese Easter Egg instead of regular Reese Cups. Don't try using Reese Easter Egg. Much better with Reese Cups. My family really liked it though. The dough was fantastic. 
 CJT.

These are great! Easy to make. My pan size was a little off, but they still worked. Doubled recipe when I made it so I could freeze some for future use, but ended up using second batch at the same time, using a bag of Rolos instead. Which was good because these did not last long at all. Did freeze candy first as suggested by other bakers.
The cookies were very rich. It did not stop the 8 yearold twins from eating them, but mom and dad had some trouble.
the batter was sooooooooooooo liquidy i had to add more flour
These cookies are super easy to make and are very tasty. The best part is you can substitute the peanut butter cups for any chocolate like snickers.
8 minutes was way too long. I would start checking them at 6...
Awesome cookies! Will definitely make again.

I‚Äôm so glad I came across this recipe - a keeper for sure! I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing, they turned out perfect! I was a little worried because I didn‚Äôt have a mini muffin pan so I used a regular muffin pan, but they still turned out just fine.

I made these, following the recipe. I did freeze the peanut butter cups and refrigerated the dough. I used a cookie sheet, because I don't own mini muffin tins. Everyone who had them, raved that they were the best peanut butter cookies they have ever had. This recipe is definitely a keeper and I will invest in mini muffin tins.
Came out perfectly. However,if you are using a 1.5 oz disher to measure your dough you won't get 40 cookies,you get 30. But that's okay, just means some left over peanut butter cups!
Yes I will make it agemn
taste extremely good, it‚Äôs very peanut buttery which i loved in these cookies but overall they are delicious

Made these for the first time at Christmas. They are so easy and taste fantastic. As others suggested, I put the peanut butter cups in the freezer before pressing them into the cookie. A definite keeper.
Super easy! A big hit with my kids!
We did not like these. I like the traditional recipe best
I‚Äôve been using this recipe for a number of years now, and they always turn out wonderfully! The recipe flows easily and makes a fluffy, silky smooth batter.
Taste soo good and I love it easy to do and I will make it again. Actually its my second time making it.

These were so good that I had to make them twice as they kept disappearing. Family loved them. Best advice is to put the peanut butter cups unwrapped in freezer while preparing so they don‚Äôt melt when pressing into cookie. Enjoy!
I didn‚Äôt have a mini muffin pan but the larger one worked out ok. Great recipe!
Didn‚Äôt have mini muffin pan...still were great!
Quick and easy to make and kids (and peanut butter junkies) love them! Wouldn't change a thing!
I followed the recipe as written and they came out perfect. I will be making these again.

follow he reviews, freeze the pb cups and then refrigerate to cool allowing to take out of muffin tin easier. I admit, I used cooking spray on the muffin tin to make a little easier to remove and I would make the same way again. I am glad to have 2 mini muffin tins, I do not like the wait to wait to make the next batch.

Oh my gosh ‚Äì fantastic! I took other reviewers' advice and put the Reese's in the freezer. They went in easily. 

Make sure the cookies are completely cooled before you removed them. I put the pan in the fridge for a while before taking them out. Seemed to work well! 

I doubled the batch and was expecting to end up with 80. I ended up with closer to 60 cookies instead. 


 Worked beautifully.
I ran out of unsalted butter, and I used salted butter which worked fine, just don‚Äôt use salt. Great recipe for a holiday party!
Awesome !!!
I Love this recipe.. I make it every year at Christmas My family looks forward to these cookies. So easy to make.
Delicious cookies. I did cut baking time to 6 minutes however I was using a convection oven and 8 minutes was too long.
Really delicious Cookie is creamy when biting into it. Yummy
OMG!!! These were so good coming out of the oven! It was really easy to find the ingredients and make it! I‚Äôd love to cook some more up!
Good recipe...easy to make and exactly as expected. Yummy
I would give this recipe 10 stars if I could. Easy, yummy. Just the right amount of sweetness and peanut butter! I have added it to my collection!!
These are always a hit. They are everyone's favorite!
Easy, tasty, they were a hit!
Super easy and makes a lot. Great recipe for sharing.
